page.title: 01Brushford & surrounding area
page.content: Brushford & the immediate surrounding area has changed very little with the passing of time. The church is beautifully kept & dates back to the 12th century & is situated picturesquely on the top of Brushford Hill. There are several interesting houses in the area. Below the church is Brushford Barton. Although the facade is 19th Century much of it dates back further. It is clearly visible from the main road below (B3220). Brushford Mill (a former mill) lower down on the River, Abbotsham, which was once a monastry. From here the monks travelled from the farm to mine silver below Reeve Farm to the North of the area. Very few of the dwellings in Brushford are visible from the road as most are down long tracks.
